newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila call loan rate slips on square positions.
newsitem.headline: Manila call loan rate slips on square positions.

text.p: * Banks take profits on short-term bills
Philippine call loan rates fell to an average of 11.0625 percent on Friday from 11.71875 after banks squared off their positions, dealers said.
Done rates were in the range of 12.125 percent and 10.5625, with volume down to 12.135 billion pesos from 26.125 billion.
Out of the 61 participating financial institutions, 35 were lenders.
"The market is gradually liquefying" after the tightness experienced early in the week because most banks tied their funds in fixed income securities, a dealer said.
She said banks were forced to take profits on their short-term bills to generate more liquidity.
